Landing the Job: Applications and Interviews for Educators
Module 4: Select Your Documents and Make Revisions

Select Your documents and make revisions

Read the directions below. Then, before you begin composing, review the grading criteria here: 4.2 Rubric. To submit your assignment, select the 4.2 Assignment Submission tab in this section of the module.

Assignment Submission

In this course, we discussed tips for crafting effective resumes, cover letters, and answers to interview questions (download a 1-page .PDF review of the tips here). For this assignment, you have two options:

  1. You may create a resume, a cover letter, or answers to interview questions from scratch.
  2. You may edit a resume, cover letter, or interview answer(s) that you have already created.

As you create or edit your document, you will apply at least three (3) tips that our experts offered in this course. You will be asked to explain which tips you applied and how you applied these tips in the next section of this course (4.3).

If you choose to create an answer to a potential interview question or series of questions, your final product can be a .PDF, Word Document, or Google Doc. However, it may be even more helpful to practice speaking your answer(s) out loud. Therefore, you may also choose to submit your answer as a video. Whether you choose text or a video, please include the interview question(s) you have chosen, along with your answers, in your final product.
